name: Showcase Presents Justice League of America Online Trivia | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which member of the Justice League is immune to Starro's powers?
questions.explanation:
"Snapper" Carr.

	"Snapper" Carr got his nickname from his habit of snapping his fingers when he is happy. A regular human teenager with no powers, "Snapper" is made an honorary member after the Starro adventure depicted in "The Brave and the Bold" issue #28.

questions.text: How many futuristic weapons did the villainous Xotar have in "The Brave and the Bold" issue #29?
questions.explanation:
Four.

	Xotar was convinced he would defeat the Justice League with his weapons, but Wonder Woman and the rest of the League proved him wrong. After being defeated he was returned to the future in shackles.

questions.text: In "The Brave and the Bold" issue #30, the Justice League of America were well on their way to getting their own comic book! Which villain did they face in this issue?
questions.explanation:
Amazo.

	Amazo is an android built by the scientist Doctor Ivo. Ivo stole the superpowers of the Justice League and implanted them all into his android! The JLA was saved due to quick thinking on Green Lantern's part.

questions.text: In the first issue of their own magazine, the team faced the demonic alien Despero! Which hero played a deadly board game with Despero?
questions.explanation:
The Flash.

	Although members, Superman and Batman were initially often said to be "on assignment" and were not featured in the stories. Green Arrow would not join the League until later, which leaves Flash to play a high-risk game with the enigmatic alien.

questions.text: Arcane magic played a role in the second issue of "Justice League of America". Which famous magician helped the Justice League defeat the antagonists of the issue?
questions.explanation:
Merlin.

	Merlin was the fictional magician who served as a mentor to King Arthur of Britain. In this adventure, Earth changed places with Magicland, the realm of King Arthur, so that nothing scientific would work on Earth, and nothing magical would work in Magicland.

questions.text: The Justice League is captured by the would-be dictator Kanjar Ro! He forces the team to defeat his three rivals. Which of these three characters does J'onn J'onzz subdue?
questions.explanation:
Kromm.

	Only by having the three rulers speak Kanjar Ro's name simultaneously can the Justice League be freed. This is accomplished thanks to hastily-made sound recordings. After the adventure, the three rulers and Kanjar Ro are marooned on a meteor.

questions.text: Who joins the Justice League at the end of the fourth issue?
questions.explanation:
Green Arrow.

	Green Arrow is actually the wealthy Oliver Queen, who uses trick arrows and fighting skills to combat crime! In the "One Year Later" story arc, Queen has been elected mayor of Star City.

questions.text: The Justice League nearly sees their good luck run out against Professor Fortune! Which bad-luck bringing action is not seen in the issue?
questions.explanation:
Opening an umbrella indoors.

	Green Lantern accidentally spills salt in pursuit of some criminals, while Green Arrow walks under a ladder to stop a fire. The Flash stepped on a mirror, but nobody opened an umbrella indoors.

questions.text: When "Snapper" Carr visits the fair, who goes along with him?
questions.explanation:
His girlfriend.

	"Snapper" and his girlfriend Midge found themselves on a distant planet due to the vile machinations of a group of aliens who wanted to take over the Earth! The shape shifting aliens infiltrated the Justice League, but were ultimately foiled.

questions.text: A group of criminals offers a million dollars to the person who can tell them how to get rid of the Justice League.
questions.explanation:
True.

	A small-time crook named Pete Ricketts stumbles upon a strange device that makes people do whatever he says! Trapping the whole Justice League in this fashion, he auctions them off one by one to the highest bidder!
